# Markdown

## What is Markdown?
Markdown is a way to style text on the web. You control the display of the document; formatting words as bold or italic, adding images, and creating lists are just a few of the things we can do with Markdown. Mostly, Markdown is just regular text with a few non-alphabetic characters thrown in, like # or *.
___
## Syntax guide
* Headers

To make a head just Use # then write the and the number of # represent the head number Ex:
 # This is an <h1> tag
Using one #
___
## This is an <h2> tag
Using ##
___
###### This is an <h6> tag
Using ######
___

* Emphasis

*Italic*: for this feature use *  or _ at the beginning and end of the text
  *This text will be italic*
___
**Bold** for this feature use two ** or two _ _at the beginning and end of the text
___
* Unordered list: type * then write the first item then press enter and repeat the process till last item EX:
* Item 1
* Item 2
  * Item 2a
  * Item 2b
___
* ordered list: type 1. then write the first item then press enter type any number and type item repeat the process till last item EX:
1. Item 1
1. Item 2
1. Item 3
   1. Item 3a
   1. Item 3b
   ___
•	Image: !Then [image’s name]Then (url)

![GitHub Logo](data:image/png;base64,)
___

•	Links: first [name of link] then (url)
EX:
[GitHub](http://github.com)
___

•	 Blockquotes: type> then write the Quote
As Kanye West said:

> We're living the future so
> the present is our past.

___

•	Inline code: Put it Between ``

I think you should use an
`<addr>` element here instead.
___
___


## GitHub Flavored Markdown
GitHub.com uses its own version of the Markdown syntax that provides an additional set of useful features, many of which make it easier to work with content on GitHub.com.

•	Syntax highlighting
```javascript
function fancyAlert(arg) {
  if(arg) {
    $.facebox({div:'#foo'})
  }
}
```
___

•	Task Lists
- [x] @mentions, #refs, [links](), **formatting**, and <del>tags</del> supported
- [x] list syntax required (any unordered or ordered list supported)
- [x] this is a complete item
- [ ] this is an incomplete item
* Task Lists
 - [x] @mentions, #refs, [links](), **formatting**, and <del>tags</del> supported
- [x] list syntax required (any unordered or ordered list supported)
- [x] this is a complete item
- [ ] this is an incomplete item
___
*Tables
You can create tables by assembling a list of words and dividing them with hyphens - (for the first row), and then separating each column with a pipe |:
First Header | Second Header
------------ | -------------
Content from cell 1 | Content from cell 2
Content in the first column | Content in the second column

___
## What is the github pages?
GitHub Pages lets you turn GitHub repositories into websites that showcase your portfolio, your projects, their documentation, or anything else you want to share with the world.
